channel.title: Transferring Kicad Schematics to PCB on Embedded Systems Design
channel.description: Recent content in Transferring Kicad Schematics to PCB on Embedded Systems Design

item.title: Assigning Footprints
item.description:
Introduction

Prior to transferring a schematic to a PCB design, it is necessary to assign footprints to each symbol in your schematic

item.title: Electrical Rules Check (ERC)
item.description:
Introduction

In the last tutorial you created a schematic. But is it any good? The electrical rules check, or ERC, is a useful way to debug your circuit. This example tutorial takes you through the process of finding and eliminating circuit design errors.

item.title: Importing Netlist into KiCad PCB
item.description:
Introduction

We are now ready to transfer over from Schematic Editor to PCB Editor. In order to get to this step, we had to make sure a couple things were taken care of:

item.title: Using the KiCad Footprint Editor
item.description: How to manually create a footprint using the KiCad footprint editor

item.title: Using the KiCad Footprint Wizard
item.description: How to create a footprint using the footprint wizart for standard footprints and shapes
